analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One:

original: “Bhidurāyaṁ, bhikkhave, kāyo, viññāṇaṁ virāgadhammaṁ, sabbe upadhī aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: bhidurāya bhikkhave kāyaḥ viññāṇam virāga dhamma sabbe upadhī aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāma dhammā  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: “This body, monks, is fragile, consciousness is subject to fading away, all acquisitions are impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“Having known the body to be fragile,
And consciousness to be subject to fading away,
He has gone beyond birth and death.
The one developed waits for his time.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This too was spoken by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
